document.masterDocTitle: Six new species, complementary descriptions and new records from the Neotropical Region of the spider genus Dipoena (Araneae: Theridiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species, complementary descriptions and new records from the Neotropical Region of the spider genus Dipoena (Araneae: Theridiidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Euryopis pusilla Keyserling, 1886 : 263
, pl. 21 , fig. 311 (Female holotype from Blumenau, Santa Catarina, Brazil , deposited in the Natural History Museum, London, not examined).

Dipoena pusilla , Levi, 1963 : 165
, figs. 160–162 (Transferred from
Euryopis
); Platnick, 2013 .

Diagnosis. The male of
Dipoena pussila
resembles that of
D. atlantica Chickering, 1943
(see Levi, 1963 : 163 , fig. 154 ) in the theridioid tegular apophysis pointed (
Fig. 28
), but differs in the median apophysis longer, conductor large, theridioid tegular apophysis longer (
Fig. 28
) and in the pattern and shape of the carapace in lateral view (
Fig. 30
).
Variation. Males (n= 5 ). Total length 1.38–1.53 ; carapace length 0.65–0.73 ; femur I 0.54-0.56 . The color pattern is quite variable from dark brown to brown in carapace.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 28–33.
Dipoena pusilla (Keyserling, 1886)
: (28–30) Male: (28) palp, ventral, (29) body, dorsal, (30) body, lateral.
Dipoena peruensis Levi, 1963
: (31–33) Male: (31) palp, ventral, (32) body, dorsal, (33) body, lateral (C, conductor; E, embolus; MA, median apophysis; TTA, theridioid tegular apophysis). Scale bars: 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. Males and females were collected together in various localities in Brazil .
Distribution. Brazil (Minas Gerais, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Paraná, Santa Catarina e Rio Grande do Sul).
